summary: This bill, H.R. 2200, amends Title 14 of the United States Code concerning the Coast Guard. It mandates the retention of enlisted Coast Guard members who have completed 18 or more, but less than 20, years of service, if they are selected for involuntary separation or denied reenlistment. The bill distinguishes between Regular and Reserve members, outlining specific conditions and timeframes for their retention based on their years of service and eligibility for retirement. The analysis for chapter 25 of title 14 is also amended.
